PROPOSAL FOR A NATIONAL EFFORT BY THE CONGRESS
OF PARENTS AND TEACHERS TO BRING EDUCATIONAL
TELEVISION TO AMERICA
Although educational television stations
have sprouted in many important areas of
America, many other areas of equal importance
remain unserved. It seems to me this repre¬
sents an opportunity, an obligation, and a
challenge for the National Congress of Parents
and Teachers.
As a member of the Board of Directors of
the National Association of Educational Broad¬
casters, I have had an opportunity recently
to discuss this problem with several nationaly-
ly-recognized leaders in the field of educational
broadcasting and I have found them unanimously
agreed that if the National Congress were to engage
in an all-out effort on behalf of a nationwide
system of educational television stations that
the establishment of such a system would be
virtually assured.
It seems to me that this is a matter of
such grave importance to the welfare of children
and youth in home, school, and community that
we cannot afford to pass the opportunity by.
If you are interested in further comments
on the importance of educational television and
the possible, role of the National Congress in
this field, I will be happy to amplify my sug¬
gestions .
